data.name: Corite
data.description:
Corite – co-founded by Universal Music Sweden alumni Mattias Tengblad (CEO) and Emil Angervall (COO) – is planning to launch a new blockchain-based platform.

The platform will allow $CO token holders to participate in blockchain fan funding and promotion, get early access to invest in music projects, in addition to earning rewards for “contributing and participating in the governance of the Corite ecosystem”, according to a media release. 

The project is being developed in partnership with Swedish blockchain technology pioneers ChromaWay.

Investors include NGC, CoinCO, Coin98, KuCoin, Kyros, Exnetworkcapital, Bella Finance, 1001 capital, Hilbert Capital, artist Danny Saucedo and Hitco Entertainment Co-Founder Charles Goldstuck.

Development on the platform is already underway, with a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) slated for Q3 2021. 

Corite, which inked a partnership with L.A-based HITCO Entertainment in May, enables fans to directly invest in their favorite artists, and to earn a proportion of said artists’ streaming royalties in return.

HITCO, run by L.A Reid and Charles Goldstuck, acquired a minority stake in Corite as part of the partnership announced in May, which sees the platform expand into the US.

Corite was launched in Sweden in 2019 and has also since expanded to Europe. The company says that thousands of backers have signed up to become active stakeholders in their favorite artists through the platform.

The platform has run more than 150 campaigns, generating millions of streams. Artist collaborations include Danny Saucedo, Sabina Ddumba, Kid Travis and King Charles.
